trans-unit.source: Example of moving a log manually

seg-source.mrk: Example of moving a log manually

target.mrk: Example of moving a log manually

trans-unit.source: If you want to move the log to <codeph>g:/bigdisk/tourslog</codeph>, move the log with operating system commands.

target.mrk: If you want to move the log to <codeph>g:/bigdisk/tourslog</codeph>, move the log with operating system commands.

trans-unit.source: Then, alter the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry in <codeph>service.properties</codeph> to read as follows:

trans-unit.source: You can use either a single forward slash or double back slashes for a path separator.

seg-source.mrk: You can use either a single forward slash or double back slashes for a path separator.

target.mrk: You can use either a single forward slash or double back slashes for a path separator.

trans-unit.source: If you later want to move the log back to its default location (in this case, <codeph>d:\mydatabases\toursDB\log</codeph>), move the log manually as follows:

trans-unit.source: This example uses commands that are specific to the Windows operating system. Use commands appropriate to your operating system to copy a directory and all of its contents to a new location.
